meanings.definition: Produce or provide (a natural, agricultural, or industrial product)
meanings.sent1: The apple tree will yield delicious fruits in the fall.
meanings.sent2: The farm will yield a bountiful harvest this year.
meanings.sent3: I told the corn to yield more kernels, but it just shrugged.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work in the garden will yield a colorful bouquet of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The sun and rain together yield the perfect conditions for plant growth.

meanings.definition: Give way to pressure or force
meanings.sent1: The door finally yielded to his repeated pushes.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge could not yield to the weight of the truck.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn jar lid refused to yield to her twisting efforts.
meanings.sent4: His determination did not yield to the obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The dam had to yield to the force of the rushing water.

meanings.definition: Amount produced of an agricultural or industrial product
meanings.sent1: The yield of wheat this season was exceptional.
meanings.sent2: The factory's yield of cars has increased since last month.
meanings.sent3: The chef was disappointed with the yield of tomatoes from the garden.
meanings.sent4: The yield of milk from the cows was lower than expected.
meanings.sent5: The yield of honey from the beehive was enough to fill several jars.
